text: William Walton Kitchin was an American Democratic Party politician who served as governor of North Carolina from 1909 to 1913. His time as governor, according to one study, was one of “tremendous increases in expenditures for public education, public health service to the feebleminded, and expansion of swampland affected by significant drainage laws.”GOVERNOR WILLIAM WALTON KITCHIN, n.d., 1909-1913 A number of other reformsLaws and resolutions of the State of North Carolina. (contains details of various laws passed during Kitchin’s time as governor) such as ones concerning labor were also passed.Title: November 1909 : Bulletin of the United States Bureau of Labor, No. 85, Volume XIX, P.693-696 ==References== Category:1866 births Category:1924 deaths Category:Governors of North Carolina Category:United States representatives from North Carolina Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:20th-century American politicians
title: William Walton Kitchin
